decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to control the game by leveraging powerful artifacts and planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value through card advantage and mana ramp. Using cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Engineered Explosives, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the board until it can establish a dominant position. The deck also includes a mix of counterspells and card draw to ensure it can react to threats and maintain its advantageous position throughout the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Cryptic Command, along with removal cards like Assassin's Trophy and Engineered Explosives. The deck also utilizes artifact synergy with cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to ramp into powerful threats like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. Additionally, Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional disruption and versatility. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value and card advantage through artifact synergies.

The deck revolves around assembling a powerful combo utilizing Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, allowing for various win conditions such as Walking Ballista or Finale of Devastation. The deck also utilizes creature toolbox elements with cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Eternal Witness to provide flexibility and answers to different situations. By using cards like Eladamri's Call and Once Upon a Time, the deck can consistently find and assemble the combo pieces needed for victory in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on using creatures with synergistic abilities to quickly assemble a powerful combo, utilizing cards like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana. The deck also includes key toolbox creatures like Deputy of Detention and Ranger-Captain of Eos for disruption and versatility. Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional disruption and utility, while Finale of Devastation can tutor for key pieces. The deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with its combo potential, all while maintaining flexibility and adaptability through its toolbox of creatures.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 deck is to control the game using Urza as the centerpiece. The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and efficient removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating advantage through cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch. Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional disruption and threats, while cards like Cryptic Command and Engineered Explosives offer versatile answers to various situations. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent by efficiently utilizing powerful artifacts and control elements.

The main concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and control the game with efficient creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Spell Queller, backed up by disruptive spells like Mana Leak and Force of Negation. The deck aims to pressure the opponent with early threats like Noble Hierarch and Stoneforge Mystic, while also having the ability to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine gives the deck additional reach and resilience in longer games.

The deck aims to assemble a combo using Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, then using it to play a big Walking Ballista through Finale of Devastation. It also utilizes toolbox creatures like Deputy of Detention, Ranger-Captain of Eos, and Eternal Witness to control the board and recover key pieces. Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional disruption and protection, while cards like Giver of Runes and Noble Hierarch help to accelerate the combo. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed in fetching the necessary lands.

The deck aims to quickly ramp up its mana, utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and accelerate into Primeval Titan. Once the Titan is on the battlefield, it can search up utility lands such as Field of the Dead or Cavern of Souls, as well as threats like Vesuva or Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion. The deck also includes cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns for disruption and protection, along with counter spells like Pact of Negation to protect its key pieces. The ultimate goal is to assemble a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and utility lands.

This deck is focused on utilizing the Human creature type to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to pump up the team, combined with disruption from cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage, this deck aims to apply pressure early and often. Aether Vial helps to cheat out creatures and maintain tempo, while cards like Reflector Mage and Kitesail Freebooter provide additional disruption to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on assembling key creatures to create powerful combos using cards like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, which can be used to search for win conditions using cards like Finale of Devastation. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Deputy of Detention and Ranger-Captain of Eos to deal with threats and disrupt opponents. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to different colors of mana needed for the combo pieces and support cards. The strategy revolves around efficiently tutoring for and using creatures to win the game.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up your mana with cards like Farseek and Sakura-Tribe Elder, while also using Primeval Titan to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and mountains. Once you have enough lands on the battlefield, you can use Scapeshift to sacrifice them and search for even more mountains, dealing massive amounts of damage to your opponent with Valakut triggers. The deck also includes cards like Veil of Summer to protect your combo and cards like Hour of Promise to search for more lands to ensure your combo is successful.

This deck focuses on using the life loss from cards like Street Wraith and Mishra's Bauble to quickly bring Death's Shadow onto the battlefield as a powerful threat. It also utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to clear the way for aggressive attacks. The deck also incorporates disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Stubborn Denial to control the opponent's hand and spells. Additionally, the deck has some delve creatures like Gurmag Angler to apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional versatility and disruption.

The main focus of this Bant Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition. With a mix of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, alongside versatile creatures like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Ice-Fang Coatl, the deck aims to control the board and out-value the opponent. It also includes efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict, along with counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Force of Negation to handle threats. The deck's mana base is optimized with fetch lands and snow lands to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish board presence with efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Noble Hierarch, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Negation and Mana Leak. The deck aims to control the game tempo by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Teferi, Time Raveler. Additionally, the deck benefits from the synergy between snow permanents like Ice-Fang Coatl and Arcum's Astrolabe. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Batterskull provides additional threats and ways to close out games quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost Human creatures and using disruptive elements like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage to slow down opponents. Aether Vial allows for flash creatures like Reflector Mage to be played at instant speed, and cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish benefit from each creature entering the battlefield. The mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive elements makes this deck a formidable force in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on control elements with a strong artifact theme centered around Urza, Lord High Artificer. The key concept revolves around using mana acceleration from cards like Gilded Goose and Mox Opal to play powerful threats like Urza and Oko, while also disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal. The deck also utilizes cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Engineered Explosives to maintain board control. Overall, the strategy combines efficient removal, card advantage, and powerful threats to outvalue opponents and control the game.
